articleContent.title: Arpeggio: 9th in C# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: 9th in C# (Shape: C)

## Brief Description
In music theory, an arpeggio is the notes of a chord played in succession, rather than simultaneously. The 9th arpeggio in the key of C# (Shape: C) consists of the notes C#, E#, G#, B#, and D#.

## Breakdown of Notes and Intervals
- C# (Root)
- E# (Major 3rd)
- G# (Perfect 5th)
- B# (Major 7th)
- D# (Major 9th)

## Musical Genre and Flavor
This 9th arpeggio in C# can be used in various genres, including jazz, R&B, and fusion. It has a jazzy and soulful flavor, adding color and sophistication to chord progressions and solos.

## Songs
1. **"Misty" by Erroll Garner**
   - This jazz standard features beautiful arpeggios and chord voicings, showcasing the expressive quality of the 9th arpeggio in C#.

2. **"Don't You Worry 'bout a Thing" by Stevie Wonder**
   - Stevie Wonder incorporates intricate arpeggios in this R&B hit, highlighting the versatility and groove of the 9th arpeggio in C#.

3. **"Spain" by Chick Corea**
   - A fusion masterpiece, "Spain" by Chick Corea includes complex arpeggios and harmonic structures that demonstrate the creativity and depth of the 9th arpeggio in C#.
